chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Prado Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside without Court's permission.  May not have contact with Victims or their families.

Transcript - Status Conference- 05/03/2019

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone.  Deft reports the PD's office will not appoint an atty; deft requests court appointed atty.  Brief discussion held.  Court will not appoint advocate counsel.  Court will have the reporter prepare a transcript of today's hrg and send to deft.  Deft may then ask the PD's office whether they would reconsider representation.  Deft's PCM is denied.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft reports he is still in the processing of retaining Atty John Miller Carroll; deft reports he is waiting for documentation from his previous atty.  In addition, the deft's request for PD representation was sent to the local PD's office.  Atty Carl Johnson reported (via email) that he forwarded the deft's request to the Madison appellate office.  Court sets case over to allow deft add'l time to obtain counsel.  Status set for 5/3/19 @ 10:45am.  Deft may appear via phone for the next hrg.
Per Court, forward deft's letter requesting counsel to the PD's office - done by Clerk Lema on 3/19/19
